snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio focused on values rather than offering a blueprint for governing in a speech at the Cooper Union in Manhattan.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio marks his 100th day in office with a rhetoric-heavy speech that calls on his supporters to help him create a 'people-powered government' in the city; some elected officials say they are eager to hear more details as to how de Blasio will enact his priorities.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio focused on values rather than offering a blueprint for governing in a speech at the Cooper Union in Manhattan.

headline.main: De Blasio, Marking 100 Days on Job, Says ‘Grass Roots’ Will Drive Agenda
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, Marking 100 Days in Office, Says Grass Roots Will Drive Policies
